events.name: Hands-on: Lightspeed front to back development with Xamarin + Azure
events.description:
Let's get our hands dirty. Learn how to connect your Xamarin mobile apps to the cloud: - Get started with a Free azure subscription - Azure Deploy - Authenticate and authorize users with Twitter and Facebook  - Allow your app to work offline and sync after  - Send and receive push notifications on iOS, Android, and Windows  - Store your app data in the cloud  - Use Microsoft Cognitive Services to personalize your app’s responses 


We'll also help to set you up with a free Azure dev subscription. As this is hands on, it will be best experienced by bringing your laptop, with visual studio 2015 + xamarin installed Also, you will need  the latest Azure SDK: https://www.microsoft.com/web/handlers/webpi.ashx/getinstaller/VWDOrVs2015AzurePack.appids as well as SQL lite for UWP:  https://visualstudiogallery.msdn.microsoft.com/4913e7d5-96c9-4dde-a1a1-69820d615936 And yes, there will be a starter codebase, along with our usual live chat setup! 


Speakers: Ben Ishiyama-Levy Udara Alwis 


Live Streaming: https://www.hipchat.com/gzt4LgWd4 



Nibbles @ 6:30 PM
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: Azure UG meetup Oct 2016
events.description: Session 1  (7 to 8 PM): Part 2 - Build an IoT Solution with Azure IoT Suite & Windows 10 IoT Core This is second meetup of the planned "Azure IoT & Windows IoT Core Series" with primary focus on Azure IoT Suite and Windows 10 IoT Core. This time we have a speaker from Canada who will be speaking over Skype for Session 2. Session 2  (8 to 9 PM): Azure Service Bus 1. Abstract Have you ever wanted to know what superior messaging looks like in the cloud, or what you could get for your buck beyond the sales pitch? This session will show what Azure Service Bus messaging has to offer and why it could become the next cloud service you'll want to use.  Speaker: Sean Feldman Bio Sean Feldman is a Solutions Architect at Particular Software, the makers of NServiceBus. He is also an advisor to Microsoft's Azure teams as well as an Azure MVP. He likes tinkering with various Azure-related services and is in seventh heaven when cloud and distributed technologies are combined. When he's away from his computer and back on planet earth, he's a super dad helping his kids with their advanced math competitions, and enjoys building Arduino projects even more than his kids.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Tech Boleh Tahan: Game Dev
events.description:
Come join us next week as Nickole Li (working at DICE, previously of Ubisoft) will be sharing with us how the implementation of games will extend beyond simple idea smithing, and how game design a whole is a union of both user experience design and business.

Date and time: Thursday, 13 Oct, 7.30pm

Join Us Now at http://peatix.com/event/203850

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _
Biography

Nickole Li loves playing game when she was young, she figured if she can't be paid to play games she would understand the concept of games well enough that she will be paid to make them.

During her internship, she was working on Carneyvale: Showtime with the GAMBIT Game Lab back when it was functional. After which she went on to join Ubisoft and worked on Ghost Recon Phantoms for years.

She believes that to start on game developing, one needs to learn to think like a game developer and move beyond a simple observation of a game being fun/not fun into a more analytical mindset of how one would go about making a great/fun title.

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _
TECH BOLEH TAHAN is the rebooted series of informative talks and informal sharing sessions hosted by professionals in the technology, arts and design fields. Our goal is to provide a platform on a wide range of subject matters to foster learning, sharing, inspiration and wonder. Get excited by the latest developments in innovation, product design, interactive media, entrepreneurship - and more! If you wish to shout out at TECH BOLEH TAHAN (as a speaker, a lightning talk, etc...), please feel free to contact us at info@onemakergroup.com.
events.location: OneMaker Group - OMG, 111 Middle Road, #01-02, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969
